loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora lives in Yambio. She is 33 years old and married with four children. All of her children are still in school. 

Nora sells food at a stall. She has been in this business for three years. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 2000 in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en: Carolyn, a 35-year-old single mother of three children between the ages of 8 and 14 years, lives in the town of  Kisumu where she has operated a hair salon for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. Now requesting her first loan from KADET LTD to buy a stock of shampoo, blow dryers and hair braids, she will use the new profits to educate her children. Carolyn's dream is to own a big salon business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of shampoo, blow dryers and hair braids.

loans.name: Buenos Aires Group

texts.es: Doña Abade es miembro del Grupo Solidario Buenos Aires, es madre soltera, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales tres son estudiantes y aun dependen de ella. Doña Abade se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace siete años, inicio su negocio sola ahora tiene una pequeña tortillera, que atiende ella y mas de sus cuatro empleados desde las 3 am hasta las 12 pm. Su ventaja es que tiene una muy buena clientela, el único problema es que tiene que pagar alquiler y lo que le queda en ganancias le ayuda para cubrir el pago del local. Abade esta solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maseca y leña. Con el apoyo de este préstamo seguirá teniendo una actividad económica que le permita cubrir los gastos para la manutención de su familia y una fuente de ingresos para sus empleados. Su sueño es tener su propia casa y ayudar a sus hijos a realizarse profesionalmente. Tiene 5 años de recibir el apoyo de FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de manera puntual y los préstamos obtenidos le han ayudado a mejorar su condición de vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
Abade is a member of the “Buenos Aires” communal bank.  She’s a 40 year old single mother and has five children of which three are students and still dependent on her.

Abade has been making tortillas to sell for the last seven years.  She started her business by herself and now has a small tortilla shop that she and her four employees tend to from 3am until noon.  Her advantage is that she has a good clientele but the only problem is that she has to pay rent and what she earns in profits helps her cover the rental cost.

Abade is asking for the loan to buy Maseca [brand of corn flour] and firewood.  With support from the loan she’ll be able to continue to have an economic activity that will make it possible for her to cover costs of supporting her family and provide a source of employment for her employees.  Her dream is to have a house of her own and to help her children develop professionally.

She’s been getting support from FAMA for five years and has made her installment payments punctually; loans obtained have helped her improve her living conditions and her business.

loans.use: to buy Maseca and firewood.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: Luis Eduardo es un hombre increíble el cual se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable,  creativo y sobre todo carismático. Él se dedica a la venta  de variedad de prendas de vestir tales como: ropa interior, faldas, camisas, pantalones, etc. tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su trabajo ha sabido llevar su negocio y es el que le ha permitido ganarse el pan de cada día. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo tanto su sueño es seguir trabajándolo, de tal forma que siempre este un paso adelante de la competencia lo cual le permita mantenerse a la cabeza, como unos de los puestos de ropa más accesibles y preferidos por las personas. La ubicación del negocio es muy estratégica ya que Luis posee un puesto en el mercado central de la zona donde habita, lugar que es muy transitado en especial el puesto de Luis, ya que él siempre trata de tener variedad de prendas de vestir a los mejores precios. Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su pequeño negocio valiéndose de la solicitud del préstamo que hace a INTEGRAL para poder comprar mercadería al por mayor como: ropa interior, faldas, blusas, camisetas, pantalones y de más artículos que permitan atraer a  más clientes con el fin de mejorar los niveles de venta y de ingresos que permitan tener acceso a mejores condiciones de vida. No pierde de vista que en el pasado recibió un préstamo por esta institución con la cual está muy agradecido ya que con su ayuda le permitió seguir operando en su negocio. Espera obtener resultados positivos en esta ocasión al igual que en el pasado.
texts.en:
Luis Eduardo is an unbelievable man who is noted for being hardworking, responsible, creative and above all, charismatic.

He works selling assorted articles of clothing like: underwear, skirts, shirts, pants, etc.  He’s been in this business for several years and thanks to God and his hard work he’s managed to stay in business which has allowed him to earn his daily bread.

This business is his main source of income so his dream is to stay in it so that he will always be one step ahead of the competition which will keep him at the forefront as one of the stands that’s most accessible and preferred by people.

His business’ location is very strategic since Luis has a stand in the central market in the zone where he lives; it’s a very heavily visited place especially Luis’ stand because he always strives to have a variety of articles of clothing at the best prices.

He’s made the decision to invest in his small business availing himself of a loan request to INTEGRAL to buy merchandise like underwear, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, pants and other items at wholesale that will attract more customers so that sales levels and income will improve so that he can access better living conditions.

He doesn’t lose sight of the fact that he got a loan from this institution in the past that he’s very grateful for because with its help he was able to stay in business.  He hopes to obtain positive results on this occasion just like he did in the past.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Esly Karina

texts.es:
Elsy tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive con una tía y su prima en Puerto Cortes.
Elsy es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene un negocio de una pequeña pulpería que logro establecer hace 1 años, viéndose sin una oportunidad de empleo que le solventara las necesidades económicas del hogar. Tiene también un negocio de venta de comida como baleada, pastelitos de maíz y harina rellenos de carne, almuerzos y cenas. Manifiesta que le ha ido muy bien ya que ha sabido administrar bien su inversión. Dedicándose a trabajar todo día.
Es su primer préstamo con ODEF, el cual invertirá en comprar productos alimenticios (granos básicos)para surtir su pulpería y también en comprar  insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos para la venta. Con esto piensa aumentar sus ingresos y obtener buenas ganancias mejorando la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsy, 27, is single and lives with her aunt and cousin in Puerto Cortes.

Elsy is a very hardworking young woman.  She has a small grocery store that she managed to open a year ago since she had no job opportunities that would cover household economic needs.  She also sells food like “baleada” [a wheat flour tortilla, often quite thick, folded in half and filled with mashed fried beans], corn and flour cakes filled with meat, lunches and dinners.  She states that she’s done very well and has known how to administer her investment well working all day.

This is her first ODEF loan and she will use it to buy foodstuffs (basic grains) to stock her grocery store and also to buy ingredients to make the food she sells.  She intends to increase income and earn good profits this way improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store and ingredients to cook her dishes.

loans.name: Arnest

texts.en:
Arnest is a 38 year old man from Kisumu City. He is married to Jenipher. They have 3 kids aged 10-14 years.

Arnest operates a retail stall selling various items such as clothing like belts and purses and other assorted items. This kind of business is locally known as Malimali. He has been in this business for the last 20 years making a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy a stock of  belts, purses, photo albums, and calculators for sale. The profits will be used to buy more retail stock. His dream is to own a big business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of belts, purses, photo albums, and calculators.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 33 year old gentleman from Kisumu city. He is married to Vivian. They have three children aged four, six, and eight years.

James operates a movie and music discs business. He has been doing this for the last four years making a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is taking his first loan which he will use to buy movie and music CDs and DVDs. He will use his profits to add stock.

His dream is to have a big movie selling business in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy movie and music CDS and DVDs.

loans.name: Sitienei

texts.en:
Sitienei, a resident of Litein, in South Rift Kenya, is a 38-year-old married father of four children ranging in age from eight years to eight months. He has been a dairy farmer for 15 years and is helped by one farmhand to produce milk which he sells to the local market. He gets additional income from his teaching employment.

Sitienei has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow at 40,000 KES and construct a dairy unit with the remaining 20,000 KES. He says the farming income will help him improve his family's living standards. While lamenting the poor local markets, he thanks Juhudi Kilimo for offering grace periods in their loan services.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Vitarte Group

texts.es: La alcancía comunal “Los Angeles de Vitarte” conformado por 8 socias los cuales radican en la zona de los  distrito de Ate Vitarte de ahí el nombre del grupo, ya que todas viven en la misma zona; es un grupo nuevo que tienen todas las ganas de trabajar con Edaprospo para que les apoyen en el negocio que cada una vienen realizando. Nuestras socias hacen un gran sacrificio entre los quehaceres del hogar y sus negocios, en el caso de la Srta. Reyna (Presidenta), con  39 años de edad lleva adelante el negocio de venta de productos de bellezhace 5 años, a su vez por las tardes vende zapatillas asus clientes de confianza el presente préstamo lo invertirá en comnpras de porductos de belleza para el negocio y en continuar sus ventas de calzado. Cabe mencionar el entusiasmo y el deseo de seguir saliendo adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación hacia un bienestar y mejora de cada una de las integrantes de la alcancía comunal.
texts.en:
The “Los Ángeles de Vitarte” communal bank has 8 members who live in Ate Vitarte thus the group’s name since they all live in the same zone.  It’s a new group that very much wants to work with Edaprospo so that it will support the businesses that each one of them has.  Our members make a big sacrifice between household chores and their businesses.

In the case of Reyna, 39, (President) she’s been selling beauty products for five years and during the afternoons she sells sandals to her best customers.  She will use the present loan to buy beauty products for her business and to continue with her footwear sales.

It’s worth pointing out the enthusiasm and wish to continue moving forward with effort and dedication toward wellbeing and improvement for each one of the communal bank’s members.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Belfar David

texts.es: EL Sr. Belfar tiene 37 años  es casado pero no tiene  hijos, el se dedica al servicio de  alquiler de amplificación a distintos acontecimientos sociales, como ser bautizos, matrimonios y toda clase de acontecimientos,  solicito este  préstamo para arreglo de vehículo ya que  esto le permitirá transportar sus amplificadores ya que son muy pesados y tiene que transportar a los distintos acontecimientos,  Belfar  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar sus bienes y sueña  con  ampliar su amplificación, es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Belfar, 37, is married but does not have children.  He has a business renting sound equipment to a variety of social functions, such as baptisms, weddings and other types of social events.  He is requesting a loan to fix his vehicle, because this will allow him to transport his amplifiers.  These amplifiers are very heavy, and he has to transport them to different events.  Belfar faces challenges in his business, including the competition.  He will use the profits from his business to improve his equipment, as he dreams of having more sound equipment.  He is an enterprising person who has a strong desire to excel.  He is happy and grateful to this institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to fix his vehicle so that he can transport his sound equipment

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en:
Rahama lives in Yambio where she has been operating a food stall for the past year. She is 27 years old, married, and has four children, all of them in school.

Rahama, who learned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, is requesting her first loan from BRAC for 400 SDG in order to purchase onions and oil for resale. She will use the resulting extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and oil for resale.

loans.name: Faraj

texts.en: Faraj, a 26-year-old single man from Gaza, works in agriculture selling sheep. Now requesting this loan in order to buy sheep for his farm, Faraj hopes the loan will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Ilyos

texts.ru: Ильёс парень 30 лет, женат имеет одного ребёнка. Он занимается профессиональной съёмкой и монтажом свадебных мероприятий, а также имеет точку по продаже DVD дисков. Ильес ответственно относится к своей работе и поэтому качество его видеосъёмок на высоком уровне. На его съемку очень хороший спрос и у него много заказов. На получаемый кредит Ильес собирается приобрести партию DVD дисков.
texts.en: Ilyos is a 30 year-old guy who is married and has one child. He is a professional cameraman and editor of wedding videos, and also has a retail outlet where he sells DVDs. Ilyos has a very responsible attitude towards his work, which is why his videos are of the highest quality. There is a lot of demand for his work and he has many orders. Using this loan, Ilyos would like to purchase a shipment of DVDs.

loans.use: to buy a shipment of DVDs

loans.name: Jaime Gonzalo

texts.es:
Jaime, de oficio comerciante se dedica a las ventas de CD de música, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad en la ciudad de Estelí. Este negocio lo empezó cuando tenía 20 años de edad, lo puso con capital que tenia ahorrado de su antiguo trabajo, el trabajaba en tiendas de supermercado pero un día decidió emprender su propio negocio.  El tenia muy poca mercadería vendía muy poco CDs de música ahora vender además de eso gafas de sol, bolsos para celulares, limas. Así poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio. 
El realizo el crédito para comprar CDs, gafas, cartucheras de celular. Su idea es ir variando los productos que vende y que son de uso popular. Lograr tener una tienda de mercadería en general y  tener capital para darle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime, whose business is selling music CDs, has been working this way for ten years in the city of Estelí. He began this business when he was twenty years old. He started out with capital he had saved from his previous job, working in a supermarket. One day he decided to start his own business. He had very little merchandise and sold few music CDs. Now, in addition to CDs he sells sunglasses, cellphone cases, and shirts. Little by little, he has supplied his business this way.
He has requested the loan to purchase CDs, sunglasses, and cellphone cases. His idea is to continue varying the products he sells which are currently popular. He hopes to have a general merchandise store and have the capital to provide his family with a roof over its head.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, sunglasses, and cellphone cases.

loans.name: El Charquito Group

texts.es:
La señora Edith tiene  treinta y seis años de edad, ella pertenece a una localidad llamada El charquito un lugar bonito donde hay un rió hermoso donde las personas van a bañarse  y pasar un lindo fin de semana con su familia.
Doña Edith nos cuenta que esta orgullosa de la comunidad donde vive y de sus paisanos ya que son personas trabajadoras y honestas que se dedican a diversas actividades económicas.
Doña Edi como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  se dedica a la venta de comida como son: caldos de pollo, caldo de res con verduras, tacos blanditos de cecina, carne enchilada, tripa, empanadas de pollo y quesillo y a la venta de refrescos, sabritas y yogurt.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Antonio un señor trabajador y honesto que se dedica al trabajo de campo como es la siembra de maíz.
Tiene la cantidad de  cuatro hijos Everardo, Karen Arlet, Yamilet e Ingrid Yaret ellos son el motivo por el cual cada día se levanta con fuerzas para trabajar y superarse para que sus hijos estén orgullosos  de su madre.
Ella nos cuenta una de las experiencias mas lindas de su negocio: "hace dos años  solamente vendía tacos de tripa y de cecina y  decidí acudir a Fundación  para recibir un préstamo", gracias al préstamo compró mas carnes y verduras y unas mesas y así trabajar mas tiempo ya que también decidió vender cenas y con el paso del tiempo decidió vender almuerzos, comidas y cenas, y con sus ganancias comprar jugos, refrescos y sabritas, yogurt y verduras chile carne y un refrigerador grande, y al final remodelo su negocio para que estuviera mas amplio y llame la atención y den ganas de sentarse a comer en lugar limpio con una  comida bien sabrosa y con tortillas ellas a manos.
Lo que mas la llena de alegría a  Doña Edith es saber que con el apoyo de fundacion ha podido hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar la vida de sus hijos para que con el  paso del tiempo  puedan tenerlos recursos para cumplir sus sueños.
Doña Edith Utilizo su préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes para la elaboraron de comida como es: chiles verdes, chiles secos, cebolla, verduras, carne de res, carne de pollo, quesos y  más refrescos para la venta.
Ella nos dice que esta contenta por todo lo que le ha dado como haber conocido a fundacion ya que es como su familia por que le ayudo a ser realidad sus sueños que  es tener su taqueria.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son: 
Teodora-quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Adelina- se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Catalina-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Rosa-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Virginia- quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Hortensia-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ángela Rutila -quien se dedica a la venta de materias primas.
Antonia-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Argelia –quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Ana Maria-quien se dedica a la venta de tacos.
Dominoza-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Teodora Marina -quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Evodía-quien se dedica a la venta de pollo.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que les ha dado  para que puedan hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus vidas y su comunidad tenga mas comercios.
texts.en:
Señora Edith is 36.  She belongs to a town called El Charquito in a nice place where there is a beautiful river where people go swimming and spend nice weekends with their families.  Doña Edith tells us that she is proud of the community where she lives, and her compatriots are hard-working and honest people that are dedicated to various economic activities.

Doña Edi, as her group members call her, sells food like: chicken soup, beef and vegetable soup, soft tacos with cured meat, enchilada meat, intestines, and cheese and chicken empanadas.  She also sells soft drinks, Sabrita-brand snacks, and yogurt.

She is happily married to señor Antonio, a hard-working and honest man who works in the field harvesting corn.  She has four children:  Everardo, Karen Arlet, Yamilet, and Ingrid Yaret.  They are the reason she gets up every day with strength to work and improve herself so her children will be proud of their mother.

She told us one of her best experiences with her business:  "Two years ago, I only sold tacos made with intestines or cured meat.  I decided to approach the Fundación to receive a loan."  Thanks to the loan, she bought more meat and vegetables and some tables to work more.  She also decided to sell cured meat, and with time, she started selling lunches, meals, and dinners.  With what she earned, she bought juices, soft drinks, Sabrita-brand snacks, yogurt, vegetables, hot peppers, meat, and a large refrigerator.  She finally remodeled her business so that it was bigger and to call attention to it so people would want to sit down to eat in a clean place with very delicious food and hand-made tortillas.

What most fills Doña Edith with happiness is knowing that with the support of the Fundación, she has been able to grow her business and improve the life of her children so that as time passes, they will have the resources they need to fulfill their dreams.

Doña Edith used her loan to buy more ingredients to make food like:  green chilis, dried chilis, onions, vegetables, beef, chicken, cheeses, and more soft drinks to sell.

She tells us that she is happy for everything that has been given to her like becoming familiar with the Fundación, which is like her family because it helped her make her dreams a reality, which was to have her own taco business.

The other members of the group are:

Teodora - who sells chickens
Adelina - who sells tacos
Catalina - who sells clothing
Rosa - who sells clothing
Virginia - who sells clothing
Hortensia - who sells Mexican comfort food
Ángela Rutila - who sells raw matierals
Antonia - who sells clothing
Argelia –who sells clothing
Ana Maria - who sells tacos
Dominoza - who sells Mexican comfort food
Teodora Marina - who sells bread
Evodía - who sells chickens

They are thankful to the Funcación for the support it has given them so they can grow their businesses and improve their lives and so their community will have more businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora lives in Yambio. She is 35 years old and married. She has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Nora sells fuel. She has been in business for three years. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. She has requested a loan of SDG 3000 in order to purchase fuel. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees. This is her forth loan from BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for sale.

loans.name: Abdurazak

texts.ru: Абдуразаку 46  лет, женат,имеет 4 детей. Он добрый,трудолюбивый,отзывчивый человек.Уже 20 лет занимается производством национальных лепешек.У него много клиентов.Он мастер своего дела.Среди населения имеет свой авторитет.Это деятельность осталась ему от отца.Он очень любит свою работу и гордится выпечкой вкусных лепешек. Он кредитуется в МДО "Арванд" уже 4 года и благодарен нашей организации. На полученный кредит Абдуразак хочет закупить муку так как цена на муку снизилась.
texts.en: Abdurazak is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. He is a kind, hard-working and compassionate person. For 20 years he has been making traditional flat-breads. Abdurazak is a master of his trade, has many clients, and is highly regarded by the populace. He inherited this occupation from his father. Abdurazak loves his work and is proud of making delicious flat-breads. He has been a client of MDO Arvand, LLC for 4 years, and is grateful for their support. Using this loan, Abdurazak would like to purchase flour as its price has recently dropped.

loans.use: to purchase flour for his bakery

loans.name: Rajaboi

texts.ru: Рачабой добрый и порядочный человек, который имеет хорошую дружную семью и троих детей. Более 11 лет занимается купле- продажей скота и одновременно занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Отходы от выращивания культур идут на корм скота. В бизнесе помогает жена. Рачабой запрашивает займ для покупки двух голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. А также на остальную сумму хочет купить семена пшеницы и ячменя. Рачабой надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Rajaboi is a kind and decent man who has a nice loving family with three children. For over 11 years, he has been raising livestock and growing crops. Rajaboi uses the waste from crops to feed his animals. His wife helps him with the business. Rajaboi is requesting this loan to purchase two new animals for his herd. Using the remaining money, he would like to buy wheat and barley seeds. Rajaboi hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and seeds

loans.name: Reforma Group

texts.es:
Flora cuenta con 57 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y un sobrino los cuales están a su cargo su hijo tiene 11 años y esta en 6° de primaria mientras que el sobrino llamado Marcial  ya es mayor de edad y pronto contraerá matrimonio con su novia, el esposo de Flora se llama Calixto y es policía munipal y la apoya en el negocio.
Ella es comerciante venta de frutas y verduras ya tiene 34 años con el negocio lo cual dice que le va muy bien con el negocio pues ella ya tiene experiencia en su negocio y espera que el préstamo le ayude así para sacar adelante el negocio ya que le gustaría incrementar mas el negocio ya que es un buen negocio le esta echando todas las ganas trabajando día a día para sacarlo adelante. Ella da las gracias por el apoyo brindado que le fue de gran utilidad.
Flora pertenece al grupo Reforma cuyo nombre es por la colonia de donde viven el grupo esta compuesto por 11 personas todas mujeres trabajadoras a continuación eran mencionadas: Eulogia, Luz María, Rosa, Yazmín, Alejandra, Olga, Feliciana, Juana, Cirila, Dianaleydi, todas realizan actividades comercial como son: carnicería, ropa, venta de productos por catalogo, perfumes, frutas y verduras, artículos de bisutería, productos de abarrotes, etc.
texts.en:
Flora, 57, is married and has a child and a nephew who are in her care.  Her son is 11, and is in 6th grade, while her nephew, Marcial, is an adult and will soon marry his fiancee.  Flora's husband is named Calixto.  He is a policeman and he also helps her with her business.

Flora is a merchant who has been selling fruits and vegetables for 34 years.  She says that her business is going very well.  She already has experience with her business and she expects that this loan will help her to get ahead with her business, as she would like to grow the business more.  Because it is a good business, she is always giving it her best each day so that she can make progress with it.  Flora gives her thanks for the support provided, which has been very helpful to her.

Flora belongs to the communal bank "Reforma," which is named after the neighborhood where the members live.  This group has 11 members, who are all hardworking women.  The group includes: Eulogia, Luz María, Rosa, Yazmín, Alejandra, Olga, Feliciana, Juana, Cirila, and Dianaleydi.  They all work as merchants, selling items such as: meat, clothing, products through a catalog, perfumes, fruits and vegetables, accessories and costume jewelry, groceries, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as: apples, oranges, beans, chilis, and tomatoes

loans.name: Grupo Guasaule 4 Group

texts.es:
Doña  Luz  es  un  señora muy trabajadora  dedicado  a su trabajo,  madre soltera, ella tiene 2  hijos   mayores  de  edad y   le  ayudan  en  la  parte  económica.  Doña Luz tiene su negocio   en  la  aduana  de  Guasaule, en  el  sur  de  Honduras.  Desde hace  mas  de  15  años se  dedica   a  Lo que  es  la  venta  de  comida y pollo  frito.  Doña  Luz  el  préstamo lo necesita   Para  la  compra  de  pollo, canes, lácteos y  condimentos. Este crédito  le  ayudara   ya  que  tendrá  capital  fresco para invertir   ya  que  trabaja  con algunos clientes y les da  crédito, Doña Luz sueña   con comprar un  micro bus  para  a si tener  mejores  ingresos  para  bienestar  de  sus  hijos.
Kenia,  se  dedica  a la  venta  de  comida  en la  aduana  de  Guasaule  desde  hace  mas  de  3  años y  actualmente    vive  con  su  esposo.
Mirna, se  dedica  a la  venta  de  ropa  nueva   desde hace  mas  de   4  años, es madre  de  2  hijos  y  actualmente  vive  con su  esposo.



Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Luz is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her work. She is a single mother with two adult children who help her financially. Luz has her business in the border town of Guasaule, in southern Honduras. For more than fifteen years she has sold fried chicken and other foods. Luz is requesting the loan to purchase chicken, sugar, dairy products, and condiments. This loan will help her to have fresh capital to invest since she already works with some clients who provide her with credit. Luz dreams of purchasing a microbus to earn more revenue and provide for her children’s well-being.
Kenia, who has worked for more than three years selling food in the border town of Guasaule, currently lives with her husband.
Mirna, who has worked for more than four years selling new clothing, is the mother of two children and currently lives with her husband.

Choluteca, Honduras – March 2012

loans.use: to purchase soda pop, beef, chicken, pork, and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Vianca Maribel Sandoval Zeña

texts.es:
Vianca tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan con frecuencia la zona. Esta actividad le provee de una fuente estable de ingresos con los cuales saca adelante a su joven familia. Adicionalmente tiene una bodega donde ofrece abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad y ropa.

Vianca desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado de modo que puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio, además de comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales.  Y, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Vianca is 27 and single.  She lives with her family in the district of Mochumí, which is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

She has raised and sold animals for two years.  She raises poultry and small animals behind her home.  When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to businesspeople that frequent the area.  This work has proven to be a stable source of income for her and helps her young family get ahead.  She also has a small bodega where she sells groceries, basic goods, and clothing.

Vianca hopes to improve on raising her animals by acquiring nutritious food for them so she can sell them at a better price.  To accomplish her goal, she saw it necessary to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 PEN.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store and to buy nutritious food for her livestock.

loans.name: Halimajon

texts.ru: Халимачон 1951 года рождения, имеет 2 сыновей. Она реализует оптом пластиковые сетки и другие хозяйственные товары. Практически у нее круглый год реализация и сезонность. Ее лавка находиться на центральном рынке города. Халимачон сотрудничает с нашей организации с 2009 года. Стаж торговли на рынке почти 15 лет. Она очень была рада сотрудничеству с нашей организацией и  благодарна за финансовую поддержку
texts.en: Halimajon was born in 1951. She has 2 sons. She is engaged in bulk sales of plastic netting and other household goods. Halimajon makes sales virtually year-round, and stocks seasonal products. Her shop is located at the city's central market. Halimajon has been a client of MDO Arvand, LLC since 2009, and has almost 15 years of experience selling goods at the market. She has been glad to work with MDO Arvand, LLC and is grateful for their financial support.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa lives in Yambio. She sells clothes, and has been in business for 3 years. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Teresa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fifth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2500 SDG in order to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nicholas Nyamoti

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 39-year-old man from the Nyamusi area and is married to Bethsheba. They have four children aged 6 to 18 years. 

Nicholas operates a business selling clothes, a business that he has been doing for the last 6 years making a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has applied  for his fourth loan from KADET LTD., which he will use to buy a stock of used clothing for sale. 

His profits will be used to add more stock of clothing for sale. Nicolas' dream is to increase his stock of clothing to meet his clients' demands.

loans.use: To buy a stock of used clothing for sale.
